```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
install.packages("ggpubr")
install.packages("viridis")
install.packages("hrbrthemes")
```

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(viridis)
library(hrbrthemes)
```
```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
filename="OD4.csv"
attenuation=read.csv(filename)
exceldata = attenuation 
dfdata = data.frame(exceldata)
dfdata
```
```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
pdf('OD-Cop.pdf', width = 7, height=5)
ggplot(dfdata, aes(x=Time, y=OD, color=Group)) +
  geom_line(linewidth=2)+theme_classic()+scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(600, 1200, 1800, 2400,3000))+theme(legend.position="bottom")+guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(size = 3)))+scale_colour_manual(values = c("0%"="gold", "10%Cop"="darkgoldenrod2", "20%Cop"="darkgoldenrod", "40%Cop"="darkgoldenrod4"))
```

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
pdf('OD-Cop.pdf', width = 7, height=5)
ggplot(dfdata, aes(x=Time, y=OD, color=Group)) +
  geom_line(linewidth=2)+theme_classic()+scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(600, 1200, 1800, 2400,3000))+theme(legend.position="bottom")+guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(size = 3)))+scale_colour_manual(values = c("0%"="mediumseagreen", "10%Cop"="mediumaquamarine", "20%Cop"="#5ab4ac", "40%Cop"="darkslategray"))

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
filename="OD.csv"
attenuation=read.csv(filename)
exceldata = attenuation 
dfdata = data.frame(exceldata)
dfdata
```
```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
pdf('OD.pdf', width = 10, height=5)
ggplot(dfdata, aes(x=Time, y=OD, color=Group, shape=Group)) +
  geom_point(size=1)+theme_classic()+scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(600, 1200, 1800, 2400,3000))+theme(legend.position="bottom")+guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(size = 3)))+scale_colour_manual(values = c("0%"="#d8b365", "10%Cho"="#5ab4ac", "10%Cop"="coral3", "20%Cho"="coral4", "20%Cop"="coral2", "40%Cho"="coral1", "40%Cop"="gold3"))
```

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
pdf('OD.pdf', width = 10, height=5)
ggplot(dfdata, aes(x=Time, y=OD, color=Group, shape=Group)) +
  geom_point(size=1)+theme_classic()+scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(600, 1200, 1800, 2400,3000))+theme(legend.position="bottom")+scale_fill_discrete(labels = c("0%", "10%Cho", "10%Cop", "20%Cho", "20%Cop", "40%Cho", "40%Cop"))+guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(size = 3)))
